name: biobb_amber CestatsRun
title: Wrapper of the AmberTools (AMBER MD Package) cestats tool module.
description: Analyzing the results of constant Redox potential MD simulations using cestats tool from the AMBER MD package.

input_cein_path.description: Input cein or cpein file (from pmemd or sander) with titrating residue information

file_formats.description: Input cein or cpein file (from pmemd or sander) with titrating residue information
Input cein or cpein file (from pmemd or sander) with titrating residue information
Output ceout file (AMBER ceout)
Output ceout file (AMBER ceout)
Output ceout file (AMBER ceout)

output_dat_path.description: Output file to which the standard calceo-type statistics are written

Output file to which the standard calceo-type statistics are written

output_population_path.description: Output file where protonation state populations are printed for every state of every residue

timestep.description: Simulation time step -in ps-, used to print data as a function of time.

verbose.description: Controls how much information is printed to the calceo-style output file. Options are: False - Just print fraction protonated. True - Print everything calceo prints.

interval.description: Interval between which to print out time series data like chunks, cumulative data, and running averages. It is also used as the window of the conditional probability time series.

reduced.description: Print out reduction fraction instead of oxidation fraction in time series data.

eos.description: Print predicted Eos -via Nernst equation- in place of fraction reduced or oxidized.

running_avg_window.description: Defines a window size -in MD steps- for a moving, running average time series.

chunk_window.description: Computes the time series data over a chunk of the simulation of this specified size -window- time steps.

cumulative.description: Computes the cumulative average time series data over the course of the trajectory.

fix_remd.description: This option will trigger cestats to reassemble the titration data into pH-specific ensembles. This is an exclusive mode of the program, no other analyses will be done.

conditional.description: Evaluates conditional probabilities. CONDITIONAL should be a string of the format: <resid>:<state>,<resid>:<state>,... or <resid>:PROT,<resid>:DEPROT,... or <resid>:<state1>;<state2>,<resid>:PROT,... where <resid> is the residue number in the prmtop and <state> is either the state number or -p-rotonated or -d-eprotonated, case-insensitive.

restart.description: Do not execute if output files exist.
